articles.headline: Signs of Hope Emerge in the West Bank
articles.snippet: Under the rule of the Fatah-dominated Palestinian Authority, security and the economy have improved.
articles.abstract: Under the rule of the Fatah-dominated Palestinian Authority, security and the economy have improved.
articles.lead_paragraph: NABLUS, West Bank  The first movie theater to operate in this Palestinian city in two decades opened its doors in late June. Palestinian policemen standing beneath new traffic lights are checking cars for seat belt violations. One-month-old parking meters are filling with the coins of shoppers. Music stores are blasting love songs into the street, and no nationalist or Islamist scold is forcing them to stop.

articles.headline: With Power, the Risk of Abuse
articles.snippet: As big shareholders gain more sway over director elections, the S.E.C. would do well to require more disclosure.
articles.abstract: As big shareholders gain more sway over director elections, the S.E.C. would do well to require more disclosure.
articles.lead_paragraph: The power of institutional shareholders over the companies they own is set to grow sharply in 2010  and may already be on the rise as corporate boards and managements see the changes coming.

articles.headline: Seasoned Celebrity-Watcher Turns From Print to Web
articles.snippet: Bonnie Fuller, a longtime magazine chief, shelves plans to run her own company in favor of taking on a crowd of online competitors.
articles.abstract: Bonnie Fuller, a longtime magazine chief, shelves plans to run her own company in favor of taking on a crowd of online competitors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bonnie Fuller, last seen leaving her job a year ago as editorial director of American Media to form her own media company, has taken a job as the editor in chief and president of Hollywood Life, a Los Angeles entertainment Web site focused on celebrities that does events as well.

articles.headline: A Hollywood Blogger Feared by Executives
articles.snippet: On her influential blog, Nikki Finke writes about the business side of the entertainment industry.
articles.abstract: On her influential blog, Nikki Finke writes about the business side of the entertainment industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Right now, there’s a good chance a Hollywood executive is leaning into a colleague’s office and quietly asking, “Did you see what Nikki just wrote?”

articles.headline: In Push for Cancer Screening, Limited Benefits
articles.snippet: For many cancers, early detection efforts offer little benefit at high expense, and present a real risk of harm.
articles.abstract: For many cancers, early detection efforts offer little benefit at high expense, and present a real risk of harm.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Don’t forget to check your neck,” says an advertising campaign encouraging people to visit doctors for exams to detect thyroid cancer.

articles.headline: Democrats Drop Key Part of Bill to Assist Unions
articles.snippet: Abandonment of a so-called card check provision was an example of the power of moderate Democrats to constrain their party’s more liberal legislative efforts.
articles.abstract: Abandonment of a so-called card check provision was an example of the power of moderate Democrats to constrain their party’s more liberal legislative efforts.
articles.lead_paragraph: A half-dozen senators friendly to labor have decided to drop a central provision of a bill that would have made it easier to organize workers.

articles.headline: Tehran Losing Iranians’ Trust, Ex-Leader Says
articles.snippet: A former Iranian president, Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, called for the release of hundreds of democracy advocates and protesters who have been arrested recently.
articles.abstract: A former Iranian president, Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, called for the release of hundreds of democracy advocates and protesters who have been arrested recently.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon  As thousands of protesters chanted Friday in the streets outside, a former Iranian president, Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, assailed the government’s handling of the post-election unrest, saying it had lost the trust of many Iranians, and called for the release of hundreds of those arrested in recent weeks.

articles.headline: Citigroup and BofA Profits Aided by Asset Sales
articles.snippet: Behind the reports was a sober reality: Those robust profits were driven by billions of dollars in one-time gains.
articles.abstract: Behind the reports was a sober reality: Those robust profits were driven by billions of dollars in one-time gains.
articles.lead_paragraph: The problems at the nation’s big banks have caused trouble for many ordinary Americans. But increasingly, it is the problems of ordinary Americans that are causing trouble for the big banks.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced
